page.title: 15WELSH LANGUAGE IN NANTGLYN.
page.content: The area has retained its Welsh language although many English speaking families have recently bought farms and private dwellings. Despite this influx, the basic nature of the area has not changed. The chapels are still thriving, and regular Welsh services are held. The Community Council conducts its meetings in Welsh and the minutes are produced in Welsh. The newcomers have integrated very well into the community and the local residents have accepted them.They meet often at non secular events. The school has tried to retain its Welshness but has recently found it difficult. There are 24 families represented at the school:13 are Welsh speakingand 11 are English. In the parish 69% of the people are Welsh speaking(1981 census).
